comments:
If I start Eclipse with IBM JRE 1.5 and try to open the Remote System Explorer perspective, I get an error dialog and the perspective does not come up.

Here is what I see in the .log file. There seems to be a problem with LocalFileService class.

RSE 1.0 Testing round 1
installation : Eclipse M20060629-1905 platform-3.2
RSE install  : download RSE-SDK
java.runtime : J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Windows XP x86-32 j9vmwi3223-20060222a (JIT enabled)
os.name:     : Windows XP 5.1, Service Pack 2
*** Bug 158524 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 160097 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I ran into this problem with the following configuration (in case it helps):

  Linux distro version: RHEL WS release 4 (Nahant Update 4)
  Linux kernel version: 2.6.9-42.0.2.EL
  Java version: IBM Java JRE "1.5.0"
  Eclipse version: 3.2
  TM version: RSE-SDK-1.0M5.zip

The problem did not occur with IBM JRE 1.4.2.

Kushal, Shawn - it was suggested that it might be possible to fix the issue by compiling RSE with the -inlineJSR compiler switch. This has been done for N-build

http://download.eclipse.org/dsdp/tm/downloads/drops/N20061010-0100/index.php

Can you please check if it works OK with this build?

Martin, I tried the new build and it seemed to work with IBM JRE 5 (1.5)!

Note that I am new to RSE, so I was not able to do an exhaustive test.  However, it did not exhibit the bugs that I previously reported.  I was able to open the RSE perspective, view local files, and launch a local shell.
Works ok for me too. I'm closing the bug.

traces.message: Exception in org.eclipse.rse.ui.RSEUIPlugin.start() of bundle org.eclipse.rse.ui.
